page.title: 09PIT STRIKE 1984-85,SEAHAM
page.content: IN MARCH 1984 MINERS FROM ALL OVER THE COUNTRY BEGAN A STRIKE OVER PLANNED CLOSURES OF COLLIERIES AND LOSS OF JOBS.IT WAS A BITTER STRUGGLE WHICH LASTED FOR ALMOST A YEAR.MANY MINERS FROM SEAHAM WENT BACK TO WORK AND TEMPERS RAN EXTREMELY HIGH.SOME WORKING MINERS HAD THEIR WINDOWS BROKEN BY STRIKING MINERS.THERE WERE SOMETIMES AS MANY AS 1000 PICKETS AT THE SEAHAM COLLIERIES.THEY LAID GLASS IN THE ROAD TO HAMPER TRANSPORT.THE WORKING MINERS WERE TAKEN TO WORK IN BUSES THAT HAD THEIR WINDOWS COVERED WITH WIRE MESH.THE DRIVERS COVERED THEIR FACES SO AS NOT TO BE RECOGNISED.STRIKERS HAD NO MONEY. CHRISTMAS PRESENTS FOR CHILDREN WERE DONATED BY OTHER GROUPS AND CLUBS.WHEN IT WAS ALL OVER THE MEN RETURNED TO WORK BUT THERE WAS MUCH BAD FEELING BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF PEOPLE.
